TEI.2.document_citation: Eugene Barker, ed., Annual Report of the American Historical Association for the Year 1919: The Austin Papers, (Washington, D.C.: Government Printing Office, 1924), 3 vols., Vol 1, Part 2, pp. 1458-1459
TEI.2.document_title: James Cummins to Stephen F. Austin, 09-19-1826

barker_notes.barker_summary: James Cummins to Austin, September 19, 1826. Lost horse.
barker_notes.barker_citation: Eugene Barker, ed., Annual Report of the American Historical Association for the Year 1919: The Austin Papers, (Washington, D.C.: Government Printing Office, 1924), 3 vols., Vol 1, Part 2, pp. 1458-1459

text.body:
*div1 type="summary"* *p*James Cummins to Austin, September 19, 1826. Lost horse.*/p* */div1*
*div1 type="body"*
*p**location_mentioned*Colorado */location_mentioned**date_mentioned n="09-19-1826">Sept 19th 1826*/date_mentioned**/p* *p*Dear Sir with Respect to the Horse that *person_mentioned*Clement Delgado*/person_mentioned* Claims that he says was Sold in this *location_mentioned*neighbourhood */location_mentioned*I have done every thing in my power to find but Cannot find him nor find who had the Horse in possession if there ever was Such a Horse here—but I yet will try to find the said Horse if I Can though I believe it will be entirely out of my power you will be so good as to tell the *person_mentioned*bearor*/person_mentioned* that if I do find him or who might have had the said Horse that the said *person_mentioned*Delgado */person_mentioned*Shall have the Horse or the value thereof*/p*
*p**person_mentioned*James Cummins */person_mentioned* [Rubric]*/p* *p**person_mentioned*Colo Stephen F Austin*/person_mentioned**/p*
*/div1*
